Reviews.Title: “Poop stains on the walls???”
Reviews.Author: ls1653
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to ocean city for the weekend on a really low budget. We were so happy to hear that the alamo was giving rooms away for 85 dollars. This was the only exciting thing upon renting a room here. As soon as we walked in, it smelled of a mixture between moldy cheese and dead bodies. Laughing, we looked up to notice just a light bulb hanging from the ceiling. We entered the bathroom, the shower was small with just a pipe hanging from the wall. This all was but humorous until we noticed the massive amounts of black mold all over the sink and around the entire bathroom. Also, long black hairs were at the bottom of the shower and where u put the soap was crud and a razor blade that had probably been there for 3 years. This bathroom had never been cleaned. Ever. It was also easy to tell this since there was poop smeared all over the wall next to the toilet and on the wall next to the bed. The towels were blatantly dirty and merely refolded. I then heard this place is known for prostitution. I'm surprised we didn't end up with bed bugs or something because the blankets on top of the beds had burn holes and stains (which looked like blood). I understand that "you get what you pay for" but this place is hazardous to a homeless mans health.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay again”
Reviews.Author: Lisa W
Reviews.Content: The room smelled like mildew, the floor was dirty the cable and tv did not work and the bathroom was disgusting the door had not handle and the tub, I would not think about taking a shower in there much less putting my child in it. The whole place needs to be cleaned up inside and out, the pool had rust in it and I would not even think about eating there. SOmeone needs to call the chamber of commerence and the health inspector in ocean city to let them check it out and maybe there family could stay there. We only stayed one night and that was enough. Will never go back agin.

Reviews.Title: “Ask to see room BEFORE paying!”
Reviews.Author: SusanGJC
Reviews.Content: This place has a strict "no refund" policy so be sure to ask to see the room BEFORE you pay. The shower stall was stained, the carpet was ripped and stained, the ceiling and bathroom lights are bare bulbs. The sheet was clean, but thin and placed over a stained mattress with no mattress pad. There was a 1/4" space of light shining in between the door and the door frame.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad if your on a budget”
Reviews.Author: laydeebug1980
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Alamo a few times and have found that even though its old and outdated, its a place. I have not seen any prostitution or rude employees. Yes, the bathroom was tiny and old but it worked. We where there for the beach not the damn hotel! We had 7 people and only paid $95 a night which allowed our family (we have small children) the ability to do more fun things while on vacation. The bed was hard but you can't expect 5 star pillow top beds at a tiny motel just trying to get by. Also, someone had reviewed this place that stayed in 1985.....uh, it's changed owners since then. I had no bugs, no mildew, no loud teenagers, no rude staff and the pool was clean and inviting! I also did not have to walk through the bar to enter the pool. There are two entrances one gate in the fence and one in the bar (makes it nice when you need a drink). Let's figure this, people have died in other motels in Ocean City and all over the country, as long your not sharing a room with a dead body, that's not really a good point. If you were struggling trying to reach the American Dream by being a business owner, then all the negative reviews stop people from going, which in turn slows any money they could have for renovations. As I see it, if your looking for a place, not a palace then this isn't too bad. You can't find another room this cheap, hell you can't even CAMP there for this cheap. It's a room. It has locks, beds, water and a/c. Who the hell cares what it looks like? seech

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: ash4099
Reviews.Content: The price of the room was awful for what you got. We had one double bed and a bunk bed. The Tv went out in the storm at night. The shower wall had packing tape over half of it and you had to be like 4 foot tall to use the shower. There were spiders in the bathroom in each corner. Went swimming and the water came from a hose and you had to walk through the bar to get there. It was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible in 1982!!!! And I see still exactly the same!”
Reviews.Author: R0nna
Reviews.Content: I was there with friends in 1982. We mainly wanted a few hours sleep and a shower. Filthy in everyway. Nothing was even OK at all... Couldn't even take a shower because it was only dripping and the water was total rust. We got ripped off. Couldn't sleep. Wasted our time and money. I can't believe health department has not shut this place down. It has to be the worst of the worst! I can't beleive it is standing!!!!! Stay far away! Not even worth it if it is the last place renting for $20 night! You have been warned. Don't come thinking we are all pampered! I was in high school and would have and did sleep on floors to go to OC!

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: roscoellkeslittleboy
Reviews.Content: some creepy one armed guy rides around in a golf cart all day ,i guess too keep an eye on all the shady people who are staying there . the rooms are horrible an the water seems too have an iron problem an we had ants in our room the one armed guy seem to get angry when i asked for another room wich was worst then the first room an this dump was 165 a night ,i stayed one night left first thing in the morning what a dump O

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay here again! I'd rather sleep in a cardboard box!”
Reviews.Author: ChrsnAsh
Reviews.Content: We booked last minute and was the cheapest in the area...there's a reason for that! The staff was friendly, no complaint there, but they didn't tell us how horrible the room was going to be!!! We stayed in room 44, the lady who worked there said the upstairs rooms were nicer...compared to WHAT?! The walls were covered in what looked like loose wallpaper, the bathroom was full of mildew and mold, and there were NO functional blinds! They were bent, broken, with sheer curtains which you could see right through! The bathroom had NO blinds at all! The carpets had cigarette burns and were never vacuumed, there were food crumbs everywhere. There were 2 sets of drawers in the room which is where we set our luggage because we were too afraid of setting our belongings anywhere else! We REFUSED to shower there because of how dirty the bathroom was. Now for the beds...the one comforter had a huge burn hole in it that went all the way down to the mattress - which shows you they do NOT change the top covers! Sheets only! I swear I have bites from unforeseen creatures in that bed! When we saw the maid go around, she only carries towels and sheets with her. I saw no vacuum and no cleaners! Oh yeah, the outside top railing is loose, so no leaning, as you may end up falling onto your vehicle! Also no trashcan! So if you have trash, you must walk OUTSIDE to go throw your trash away with everyone else's. That may not be a big deal for most, but seeing condom wrappers and used tampons in there is completely disgusting! We have a friend who lives nearby and stated this place is known for prostitution! Whether that's the case or not, I can not verify. The pool outside the hotel bar looked as if it were never cleaned, and was never occupied during our stay by us or anyone else. So if you are driving by on route 50 and see a sign that says "VACANCY" there, please keep driving. Any extra money is worth avoiding this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for economy travelers.”
Reviews.Author: thisguyistoofly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here, and it was fine. No bugs, no grime, just a regular old motel room in a regular old motel. There is a pool, bar, and a crab shack/diner. The owner was nice although a bit crude. The reviews here are from disgruntled middle class people who can't afford a better motel but still expect the comfort inn. I would and will continue staying here regardless of the biased reviews.

Reviews.Title: “I see by the reviews nothing has changed”
Reviews.Author: Nittfan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here many years ago. After reading the reviews, I see nothing has changed. I could identify with the last review TOTALLY!! We still talk about it after all these years. We travel a great deal, and "THE ALAMO" was the single worst hotel stay of our lives!! If a major thunderstorm had not ripped down our tent at Assateague State Park, we never would have stayed there ...........

Reviews.Title: “oh my god, i cant believe they can stay in business...”
Reviews.Author: cwsth29
Reviews.Content: This could be the funniest thing I have ever read, I stayed there back in 05 with my gf and a few friends... We decided to go to Oc for a one day getaway... This is the most disgusting place ever!!! I remember the lights didnt work, bathroom door didnt close, bed were crooked!!! writing on the walls, pool had green slime in it, looked like someone flicked boogers on the walls.... I travel quite a bit and still cant believe how bad this place is... Take your video camera as we recorded a video of how bad it is, we still laugh bout it to this day....I didnt even sleep nervous about being shot

Reviews.Title: “Close to Ocean city”
Reviews.Author: tashybaby28
Reviews.Content: When went down to ocean city md for one day and we was looking for a cheap motel or hotel. We only paid 150 dollars for 7 people. We had one master bed and two bunk beds. There was hair on the sheets and pillows cases on the master bed and we smelled the sheets and the pillows cases and they smelled clean. There was a hole in the master bed wall. And also in the master bed room there was two bulett holes in the window. There was dust on the a.c in both rooms. The master bed felt like you was sleeping on the floor. The bunk beds felt like you was sleeping on spings. There was sinks that was stained in the bed rooms. And yes the there is a sink in each room. The cold water smelled like eggs. And the shower was cracked. There was hair in the shower. No t.p on the roll. Stains in the tub and in each sink. We went to the oecean for the day and we locked the door before we lefted and we got back and the door was unlocked thank god we took are money and stuff with us. I seen a sign that said hot fresh coffee for 2 dollars in the restraunt. So in the a.m i went down to get some coffee for 2 dollars and the ower that only has one arm told me that they had no coffee and that they sell coffee at the wawa. The pool looked clean but there was no one in there. The resturant/bar looked small but was clean. If this place had better mangerment and better house keepers it may look better. And work on redoing the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Please look at the room before you give them any money!!!”
Reviews.Author: J-Lynn53519
Reviews.Content: Went on a small vacation to Ocean City, MD and prebooked this hotel. Wish I would have looked into this more. My mistake was not looking at the room before paying. We went into the room, rugs filthy, air conditioner didn't cool room, the bathroom had bugs crawling up the walls. Toilet handle broke and when you sat on toilet it wobbled. Mold and mildew in bathroom, with shower curtain hanging by a handful of hooks. Windowsills had dead bugs on it. Room air conditioner must have had a 1/2 inch of dust on the vents. I was afraid to sleep in the bed if the rest of the room was this filthy.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting - unhealthy - bugs - no cleaning - horrible”
Reviews.Author: hdfan09
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one night. When I went to check in the room I had reserved had a small refridgerator in it and it was leaking on the floor so I moved to the room next to it. I only dropped off my luggage and went out right away before inspecting the room. The carpet was disgusting. The bathroom had dozens of bugs (small ants and spiders) in it, not to mention the tub. The sink was falling off the wall and the window was - not boarded up - but a piece of foam covered the window and was duct taped to the wall. I was afraid to turn off the lights. There was a used soap package on the bathroom floor and a used/empty water bottle next to the bed. There were cob webs on the walls like it hadn't been cleaned for the season. The door didn't close properly as it appeard to have been kicked in prior our stay and fixed enough to close. It was unhealthy, unsafe, noisy, and overall a disgusting experience. I would discourage anyone who wanted to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I thought I'd seen the worst hotel ever but I was wrong.....”
Reviews.Author: MiddleburyTravelers
Reviews.Content: We don't like to make reservations but after this last experience I think we might start doing that. We were tired and hot, the AC in the car was out. I was wanted to take a shower, maybe have a drink and go to bed. We knew after driving around the place that The Alamo wasn't a five star hotel, there were folks out back playing horse shoes but we thought what the heck, how bad could it be??? I didn't go in the office but I was told it was dirty. There were no real parking places so I drive up as close as I could to the building with our room in it. As I walked in my bf said "The receipt says no refunds." The musty smell, lack of carpet, one ragged curtain over each of the two windows and falling apart dressers helped me understand why. I went to look at the bathroom and it was worse than I could have imagined. The toilet was wedged in the corner so that even I being only five foot two would not be able to use it properly; there was NO room for my knees. The sink was stained beyond belief and the shower was a tiled hole complete with the echoing drip, drip of a rusted shower head and two spigots. It was late, I was hot and tired and cranky. I took a shower being careful not to touch the walls. The water was warm enough and the pressure was good. I came out of the shower to see my bf fiddling with the TV, it would NOT work and there was no remote. We don't watch TV anyway so not a big deal. I did want a drink so we went to the bar which was part of the property. I won't go into THAT because this is a review of the hotel, but EW! Back in the room we decided the sheets were clean enough to sleep on and we got ready for bed. Looking at the door I noticed light streaming through on all four sides. I was glad it's summer. To drown out the sound of the people playing horseshoes behind our room we turned the AC on, it clunked! It did bring in some cool air but it was loud. I had a drink in me, and I didn't care anymore. It wasn't an uncomfortable bed and the pillows were nice. After a so-so rest, we got up and left before seven. All that was $75. We stayed at a very nice place for less than 40 the next night. We would not have stayed if we had a child with us.

Reviews.Title: “a cheap getaway”
Reviews.Author: anurse98
Reviews.Content: I booked our reservations prior to reading these reviews. I was appalled at what i read and was very upset. my family and i have a tight buget since my husband works for the state and is currently not getting paid. So we did not have a lot of money but needed a weekend getaway. I wanted to cancel my reservations after reading the blogs, however it was to late and we would have lost our money. We decided to go anyway to see what is was like. When we arrived they had my key ready and our room was clean, the pool was clean and tidy. We had fresh clean towels and the worker were very helpful. The motel does not compare to the newer fancy hotels in ocean city it is old but the rooms were clean, there were no bugs, and it was close to everything. We weren't in our room very much but for a cheap getaway it was nice. Not fancy but clean. I am glad we went and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Alamo”
Reviews.Author: quiltingmama37
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Alamo with 3 teenage girls. It was the worst motel we stayed in. It was a spurr of the moment idea to go to Ocean City and alot of places were either booked or told us we had to rent 2 rooms. I went to the local walmart after checking in and got cleaning items to clean the whole room, while my family was at the boardwalk, and I also got sheets to lay ont he bed and we had our own blankets, The shower head was gone, and the funiture was falling apart, and the doors did not lock very good. The only positive thing to say is the owner is very friendly, the water stayed hot the whole time, and he had just put in new horseshoe pits that were nicer than the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy old heartbreaker”
Reviews.Author: roadtripperMaryland
Reviews.Content: I was out in Ocean City during the off season, and there weren't too many choices. I love old motels. When I saw the cheery neon sign with the sombrero on top, I thought I had a winner for sure. I've rarely been more wrong. Now I know firsthand what happens to these wonderful old roadside treasures right before the bulldozer pushes them aside for more generic sprawl. They are reduced to fleabags full of local losers who can scrape together enough crumpled bills to sleep in whatever rooms the management has given up on ever renting to travellers. I paid my money in the ratty office, decided that it was better to go to bed hungry than hang with the local drunks in the restaurant, and went to my room. I didn't even get one of the cool old fake pueblo rooms, I was in a crummy two-story section in the back that had likely been built in the '60s, when business was still good for these places. The room was really beat up and dirty. The carpet was filthy and worn, and the bathroom was in serious disrepair. There was a lot of black mold in the sagging ceiling over the bathtub. I turned the heat all the way up, and slept in my clothes on the mattress. The shower did work, but the water had an odd metallic tang that stuck to my skin all day. The worst part about all this is that one day, one more unique old piece of America will be lost to big box garbage, but the way it's being treated, no-one will raise their voice against it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: karmakat41
Reviews.Content: Alamo Motel is a ideal place to stay. It is very budget friendly.The room was clean. The people all were very nice.I will continue to go to this motel every year.It is within walking distance of many places to eat, which are so much cheaper than the Boardwalk.Right across the street is a place for the kiddies.There are two crabhouse's within walking distance. And you can take a short drive up to the park & ride, and catch the bus,that will take you directly into Ocean City for only a $1.00 a person. Rates during the week are only $75.00 a night, and weekends are $150.00 a night. This place has a pool, bar, and they serve food also! The bar is small, but nice. It has a pool table.Alamo Motel has alot to offer!

Reviews.Title: “It still sounds bad!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Victoryone
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alamo back in 2005. Back then, I didn't know about TripAdvisor. I wish I did. I traveled with my sister and nephew. We just wanted a clean, quite place to stay for a couple of nights while at the beach. My sister was so afraid, she did not want to even lay on the bed. Our room did smell. The front office did smell like stale cigerattes...... I'm a smoker, and it was disgusting to me. They came in our room while we were not there on several ocassions. I would leave the TV on as a test to see if someone was coming in. Sure enough, at least three times, when I got back in the room, the TV was off and a couple of items moved. Not sure who it was. Good thing we took all of our valubes with us when we left for the beach. Seems like things have not changes since 2005. I'm planning another trip to the OC. I will never forget the Alamo. It was the worst place I've ever stayed at . Just thought you would want to hear an honest opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Grosser than Gross”
Reviews.Author: dogMaryland
Reviews.Content: We went down for the first annual bike week. When we went into the rooms, it was horrible. We ran out to the CVS and bought roach bombs. Hours after letting them off, we returned to find a spider the size of Texas crawling across the bed. He must have thought it was a sprinkler. A guy from 2 rooms down came over and gave us our other key to the room that the people before us had given to him. We decided to get drunk so we could just pass out in the rooms so I went to the bar to get some cups and ice. "Lefty" (the one arm owner) had the nerve to ask me if I was going to spend any money. Well that didn't go ever too well. He practically pushed me out the door. We did not shower for 2 days, brushed our teeth with bottle water OUTSIDE and we had to park our bikes away from the room because of their "Bullroast" that brought in some real shady people. DO NOT STAY THERE!! The place should be torn down even though it's already falling apart. Bad name for OC.

Reviews.Title: “God Help Me”
Reviews.Author: Linda301
Reviews.Content: Oh My God, sleep in your car, I would have, but we were on bikes! We sat out on the bench all night, and my poor boyfriend doesn't drink, but I had to drink my fair share. It was so disgusting, someone else's stuff was still in the room. They told us someone was a regular there. I'll tell you, we brushed our teeth outside with bottled water. DON'T GO HERE! We asked them to clean the bathroom... they brought a rag and that was it. Needless to say, it was still filthy. I would not touch it, I did not shower all weekend because it was too dirty. I reported them, but they are still open. Don't turn on the water, it stinks enough to make you sick. I can't express how disgusting this place is, but I can't believe the OC authorities allow them to be open. Oh, and I wouldn't eat or drink there either. BEWARE.... Linda

Reviews.Title: “The Alamo is right out of a Hitchcock film...travellers beware!”
Reviews.Author: hollaz
Reviews.Content: The Alamo is the worst motel on this side of god's green earth. We spent $225.00 for two nights of pure unsanitary conditions rating from a toilet that did not work, no hot water, no television, and the list could go on... not to mention the seedy characters that were walking around late at night. I really thought that I was in the middle of a Hitchcock film and I was just waiting for the ax to drop. If you value life, liberty and the pursuit of happines, stay away from the Alamo.. this place is creepy, and in my opinion not safe.

Reviews.Title: “The worst motel I have ever stayed in........”
Reviews.Author: linnie24
Reviews.Content: After coming home from Ocean City I read the reviews and some are dated 2005 and nothing has changed. This was the filthiest room I have ever been in. No telephone, no curtains at the windows only a mini blind, laminate on the floors that was buckled. All of this could have been tolerable it it had been clean. The shower was filthy, blood around the base of the toilet. We were even afraid to use the faucet water to brush our teeth. Fortunately for us this was just a one-night stay because it was a Saturday night and we couldn't find another room. No dead bolts were on the door. At midnight loud music was coming from the bar area. The website makes this place look nice but beware it is not. Everything I read in the reviews is still the same.

Reviews.Title: “OH, Please”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: People stay at Alamo, because they are cheap. They pay little money, and want to get the best service, and rooms like in five star hotel. Don't complain if you don't have enough brains to book another hotel. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “The Man With 3 Limbs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our adventure at the ALAMO....We were greeted by a ONE armed man with 3 green teeth holding a sign that said "Beware of falling roaches and NO REFUNDS" By the time we had checked into the room, we had already realized that there was no other place to stay at in ocean city on a friday night so we attempted this HORRIBLE place that they call a hotel. Norman Bates drove our bags to the room in the golf cart. Once we entered the room, which note...had no number on it, nor lock, we realized that someone had possibly died in the room. We proceded to open the drawers, and quickly closed them for the cockroaches were escaping...! We then decided to go attemp the shower. After putting on our wet suits and snorckles we decided that the mildew may eat threw our shoes. So we decided it was safer to bath in the ocean. We thought that the horrible experience may soon end...until we turned down the bed sheets. The air conditioning....did not work. but it wasent so bad because the blankets weere well ventalated with ciggerate burns, the sheets looked like they have not been washed since 1972. And, the mattress looked like it hadent been replaced since moses parted the red sea. There was not much left of the walls, for the holes and roaches were consuming the rest. The Alamo....was truely the WORST experience our our entire lives. Stay at the bates motel before even considering the Alamo...even with a seriel killer, you have a better chance of leaving alive.

Reviews.Title: “Good God!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ANDEIDRA
Reviews.Content: We decided to take the kids on a weekend trip, I thoughtI did the research but what i saw when i arrived was the worst. the man at the front desk had one arm which freaked my kids out. and the swimming pool had tractor tires in it. I WAS 5MONTHS PREGNANT AND WHEN I OPEN THE DOOR TO THE HOTEL ROOM I ALMOST WENT INTO LABOR. the smell in the room was so horrible i had to ask for anotherand the other room we got was even worst..the batheroom was not finisthe it had a hug whole in the wall, the blinds wouldnt stay up so we had to nail a sheet to the window, the floor where so dirty that i had to go to the local walmar and buy carpetfresh and anti-bacterial spray.this was the worst experience ever for me. dont stay here sleep in your car if you have too and the rates are too high for what the rooms look like. i wish someone would have warned me...agb

Reviews.Title: “stay away at all cost! this place it is nasty!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: reserved a room before i did my research: after i called and reserved the room i had second thoughts. oh well i thought, i can change my mind when i get there, i dont have high standards when it comes to places but they need to be clean: the alamo wasnt. i was met by an old guy asked me to sign the credit card slip. i asked to see the room; he showed me room #9. that room smelled pretty bad when we walked in not to mention that the door wouldnt open in the beginning. the bed was made but the room hadnt been vaccumed. the bathroom had mildew on the sink and shower. it was gross, the toilet was leaking some brown water as well. i told the guy that i would come back or call in a couple of minutes. i went to the bedtime which was double the price but very nice compared to the alamo. either way i called them back stating that i wouldnt take the room and the guy yelled at me: you cant ---- do this. i told them that the room hadnt been properly cleaned and that there was mildew all over the bathroom. he then stated that he advised me when i called that the $$ are non refundable. i told him that i was never told anything when i called except the price of the hotel room. he stated that i would be out of my ---- mind. i asked him to stop using profane language and he stated that he wouldnt be afraid of me. i told him that this has nothing to do with beeing afraid its a curtesy to the customer. he told me to ---- off and hung up. i got back home today and checked my CC statement and i was charged 65$ for the room. so we will see how this ends now. it is unbelieveable to me that this place is still in business.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Cheaper is not always better! I was mislead by the photos on their website and I won't forget The Alamo! In all my 40 some years of traveling, this was the absolute worst motel I have ever stayed at. My first impression was it looked like an ethnic Bates Motel. The office reeked of body odor and stale smoke and we were greeted with the No Refund signs all over. No wonder, that's how they make their money. Once you see the room - YOU'RE STUCK! They did have number on the room doors and that was the nicest part of the room. Thank goodness the air conditioner was working properly, but there was a tree air conditioner on, I guess trying to cover up the smell of decaying bodies. We were afraid to touch anything. The walls had holes in them and some of the holes were patched up, probably with old cooking. There was no overhead light, we had one lamp, but it didn't have a lampshade. The so called furniture in the room looked like it came from the Salvation Army dumpster. The dresser mirror wasn't attached to the dresser or wall. Thank goodness we had a TV with cable, but the TV stand was missing some of it's particle board covering. There was a dresser in the closet area, but it was missing a drawer. The bathroom should have been condemned. The fixtures looked like they were pulled from The Titanic, there was so much crust on them. The tile was peeling up and curling showing the wooden floor. The bathtub and shower stall hadn't been cleaned since the Eisenhower administration. We had to close our eyes when we showered. We laid OUR towels on the floor because it was so dangerous and LEFT them there. I didn't want that toxic stuff in my car. DON'T EVER stay the night here, spend the extra money (I wish I did) and find some place nicer to stay. I wouldn't let my dead cat come to this motel!

Reviews.Title: “It would be better to sleep in traffic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I feared for my life, I had to force myself to stay up to 4 am so that I would be too tired to think about what I was laying on. We had 2 lovely holes in the wall (big enough to fit a body in) that were sealed by caulk. There was a strange sticky substance covering most of the room, I would not touch the floor with any part of my body, and the bed was almost just as bad, I was truly scared. do not stay at this place, litterally for fear of life and limb.

Reviews.Title: “Scary Gross”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Alamo for one night in July 2004. Now I have never stayed there before in my life, but my husband did as a child back in the 70's. He stated that the rooms had not changed at all. First, the room had cobwebs, smelled like rotten feet and milldew and the a/c did not have a cover. The water smelled horrible and before we left the next day, I had approx. 14 flea bites on my legs and ankles. NEVER EVER AGAIN will I stay there. Please take my advise, pay the extra money and stay at a nice hotel in downtown Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Remember the Alamo!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, son, and I took my brother to see Ocean City, and we were in for an adventure. This place was creepy, like something out of a stephen king novel! The one armed bandit that checked us in had a wife-beater tank top with many unidentifiable stains on it. It was $110 for a day and a half to stay in a third world country. We knew something was wrong when there were no numbers on the rooms. We asked a pregnant teenage girl who was hanging sheets outside on a clothesline which was our room and she didn't speak english. Our room had raw light bulbs dangling from the ceiling with numerous insects racing in and out of the fixture. There were no curtains and no bathroom door, we had to hang a sheet to keep from entertaining the other residents. The mildew and bady hair was so thick in the bathroom, that we considered "holding-it" until we could get to the beach the next day. We had to wear shoes and clothes in the shower. There was a bunkbed in the first part of the room and my brother was wracked with concern over which bunk to sleep on; the one closest to the insect superhighway(ceiling) or the dark damp urine smelling hole (bottom). My husband, infant son and I slept fully clothed on top of beach towels on the nasty bed. The other "residents" came knocking on the window to ask if we had beer. A terrified woman approached my husband and proposed that we all go find a different hotel to share, COMPLETE STRANGERS!! The toilet paper was mildewed, we wiped with napkins from the car...thank you burger king! No tv, no clock, no phone, no ac, no locks, and no refunds! Prisons have higher hygeine standards! There were so many pubic hairs in the bathroom it looked like a rug! Sleeping here should be a Fear Factor event. I felt so dirty when i left, it was like being violated. Dont walk, run from this place!

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alamo on labor day weekend 2004 and I have never been in a more disgusting filthy place in my life. We went to the local walmart to buy supplies so we could camp in our truck for the night because we were afraid of cathing something from the filth. We bought water to use because there water even smelled awful. The hole place was covered in mildew. Even though you could tell we never slept in the room and we left early the owner refused to even give us a partial refund for two nights stay If you want to stay healthy stay far far away from the alamo the worst experience ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alamo last year for Bike week. We booked 2 nights and could only stay for one, due to the condition of the room. I have never stayed in a place so gross. Since it was raining out, we sat at the bar until we were drunk enough to go back to the room and try to go to sleep. After 4 hours of trying to sleep with our heads in our duffle bags we got up and left. I did have to argue with the manager but I was refunded one night. I wouldn't recommend this place to my worse enemy.

Reviews.Title: “WRONG”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was wrong, i didn't want my bare feet to touch the floor.....bring you own sheets and pillows if you are going to stay there.....or you would be better off sleeping in your car

Reviews.Title: “nasty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Alamo was the worst placed we ever stayed!! the hotel room was infested with mildew! I couldnt touch anything! i had to bring in my own chairs. do not go to this hotel they will not give you a refund for any reason.

HotelInfo.Name: Alamo Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 12614 Ocean Gateway, Ocean City, MD 21842
